oled96: Provides functions to control the Grove OLED 0.96" from a Calliope Mini.
oled96.clearRange:
Clears a range of characters, beginning from the current
cursor position.
oled96.cmd:
Sends a command to the display.
Only use this, if you know what you are doing.
* For valid commands refer to the documentation of
the SSD1308.
oled96.initDisplay:
Resets the display and clears it.
Should be used at the start of the program.
oled96.invertDisplay: Changes the display to black characters on a white background.
oled96.normalDisplay: Changes the display to white characters on a black background.
oled96.setDisplayBrightness: Changes the brightness of the display. Values range from 0 to 255.
oled96.setTextXY: Move the cursor to a new position.
oled96.writeCustomChar:
Writes a custom character to the display
at the current cursor position.
A character is a string of 8 bytes. Each byte represesnts
a line of the character. The eight bits of each byte
represent the pixels of a line of the character.
Ex. "\x00\xFF\x81\x81\x81\xFF\x00\x00"
oled96.writeData:
Writes a byte to the display.
Could be used to directly paint to the display.
oled96.writeString: Writes a string to the display at the current cursor position.
